intro: Diplothemium littorale, commonly known as the coastal bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, sandy soils along shorelines. It has a unique root system that helps it anchor in unstable coastal environments. Its blooming period occurs in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
